channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Water leak, 8th January
item.description:
The pavement outside the Anchor Pub at Arbuthnot poses a dangerous risk to pedestrians. There has been a water leakage from the pub car park for many many years, and this build up of water has led to a huge area of ice over the past few days which trails down the (quite steep) hill towards Riverdale road. I believe this section of pavement should be gritted as a matter of urgency as it poses a serious risk to those that walk along that stretch. There is a busy bus stop adjacent to the leakage which adds to the footfall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Bridgen Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Along Pandian Way, 8th January
item.description:
Most of the street lights along Pandian Way randomly come on/off all during darkness hours. They come on then most go off then come on again, none stay on. It would appear that it is a problem with the connections. This is particularly dangerous for women walking home at night to suddenly be plunged into darkness
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northpoint Square, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
